Properties.ProtectedString:
Tool = script.Parent
local stillEquipped = false
function onEquippedLocal(mouse) stillEquipped = true if mouse == nil then print("Mouse not found") return end while stillEquipped do print("Setting Mouse to go") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunCursor.png" while Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end print("Setting Mouse to wait") mouse.Icon = "rbxasset://textures\\GunWaitCursor.png" while not Tool.Enabled and stillEquipped do wait(0.01) end end end
function onUnequippedLocal() stillEquipped = false end
Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquippedLocal) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequippedLocal)

-- Default number of bats is 3 -- Depending on the number of players in the vicinity this might increase to about 6 -- bats do tons of damage to the enemies and chase them around for a while -- 10% lifesteal back to the hand wielder
-- Should each bat be able to pick on a different character?
local Tool = script.Parent local Hand = Tool.Handle
local vCharacter local myTorso local myHumanoid
Tool.Enabled = true
local numBats = 3
local numActiveBats = 0
local duration = 30
local damage = 14
local bats = {}
local meshes = {63693995, 63694839, 63694853}
local debris = game:GetService("Debris")
local bat = Instance.new("Part") bat.FormFactor = 3 bat.Size = Vector3.new(0.6, 0.6, 0.6) bat.CanCollide = true bat.Transparency = 0.0 bat.Name = "Bat"
local batMesh = Instance.new("SpecialMesh") batMesh.MeshId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=63693995" -- front, 63694839 --back, 63694853 batMesh.TextureId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=63694777" batMesh.Scale = Vector3.new(1.5, 1.5, 1.5) batMesh.Parent = bat
local AOE = Vector3.new(20, 20, 20)
function tagHumanoid(humanoid, player) if humanoid then local creatorTag = Instance.new("ObjectValue") creatorTag.Value = player creatorTag.Name = "creator" creatorTag.Parent = humanoid debris:AddItem(creatorTag, 1) end end
function blow(hit, batObj) if hit and hit.Parent and vCharacter and myHumanoid then local vPlayer = game.Players:GetPlayerFromCharacter(vCharacter) local humanoid = hit.Parent:FindFirstChild("Humanoid") if humanoid and myHumanoid and myHumanoid ~= humanoid then tagHumanoid(humanoid, vPlayer) humanoid:TakeDamage(damage) if myHumanoid.Health + 0.3 * damage < myHumanoid.MaxHealth then myHumanoid.Health = myHumanoid.Health + 0.3 * damage end if humanoid.Health < 30 then batObj.Target = myTorso end -- Just to save the guy from a crazy bat death end end end
function chaseEnemies() print("Commencing Chase") while duration > 0 do for i = 1, #bats do local distance = 0 if bats[i] then if bats[i] then distance = (bats[i].Target.Position - bats[i][1].Position).magnitude end if bats[i] and bats[i].Target == myTorso then if distance and distance > 5.0 then if bats[i] then bats[i].BV.Parent = bats[i][1] end bats[i].BV.velocity = (myTorso.Position - bats[i][1].Position).unit * 20.0 bats[i][1].CFrame = CFrame.new(bats[i][1].Position, bats[i].Target.Position) else if bats[i] then bats[i].BV.velocity = Vector3.new(0, 0 ,0) bats[i].BV.Parent = nil end end else if distance > 1 and bats[i] then bats[i].BV.Parent = bats[i][1] bats[i].BV.velocity = (bats[i].Target.Position - bats[i][1].Position).unit * 18.0 bats[i][1].CFrame = CFrame.new(bats[i][1].Position, bats[i].Target.Position) else if bats[i] then bats[i].BV.velocity = Vector3.new(0, 0 ,0) bats[i].BV.Parent = nil end end end end end duration = duration - wait() wait() end for i = #bats, 1 do if bats[i] and bats[i][1] then bats[i][1]:Destroy() bats[i][1] = nil end end bats = {} Hand.Transparency = 0.0 wait(3.0) Tool.Enabled = true duration = 30 end
function markEnemies() local noTarget = false for i = 1, #bats do local parts = game.Workspace:FindPartsInRegion3(Region3.new(bats[i][1].Position - AOE, bats[i][1].Position + AOE), vCharacter, 100) for j = 1, #parts do if parts[j] and parts[j].Parent then local torso = parts[j].Parent:FindFirstChild("Torso") parts[j].Parent:FindFirstChild("UpperTorso") if torso then bats[i].Target = torso end end end if bats[i].Target == nil then bats[i].Target = myTorso end end for i = 1, #bats do print(bats[i].Target.Parent) end chaseEnemies() end
function flapWings(bat) local meshCount = 1 while bat and #bats > 0 do local mesh = bat:FindFirstChild("Mesh") if mesh then mesh.MeshId = "http://www.roblox.com/asset/?id=" .. meshes[meshCount] meshCount = meshCount + 1 meshCount = meshCount%3 + 1 end wait(0.1) end end
function spawnBats() for i = 1, numBats do tick() local batObj = {} local batClone = bat:Clone() batClone.CFrame = Hand.CFrame + Vector3.new(math.random(-3, 3), 1, math.random(-3, 3))
local floatForce = Instance.new("BodyForce") floatForce.force = Vector3.new(0, bat:GetMass() * workspace.Gravity, 0) floatForce.Parent = batClone
local bv = Instance.new("BodyVelocity") bv.P = 400 bv.maxForce = Vector3.new(bv.P, bv.P, bv.P) bv.Parent = batClone bv.Name = "BV" bv.velocity = Vector3.new(0, 0, 0)
batClone.Parent = game.Workspace
batObj.Target = nil batObj.Duration = 30 batObj.BV = bv
table.insert(batObj, batClone) table.insert(bats, batObj)
batClone.Touched:connect(function(hit) blow(hit, batObj) end)
coroutine.resume(coroutine.create(function() flapWings(batClone) end)) end print("Number of bats", #bats) markEnemies() end
function onActivated() if Tool.Enabled == false then return end
vCharacter = Tool.Parent myTorso = vCharacter:FindFirstChild("Torso") or vCharacter:FindFirstChild("UpperTorso") myHumanoid = vCharacter:FindFirstChild("Humanoid")
if myTorso == nil or myHumanoid == nil then return end
Tool.Enabled = false
Hand.Transparency = 1.0
local players = game.Players:GetChildren() local count = 1 for i = 1, #players do if players[i] and players[i].Character and players[i].Character ~= vCharacter then local torso = players[i].Character:FindFirstChild("Torso") or players[i].Character:FindFirstChild("UpperTorso") if torso then local distance = (myTorso.Position - torso.Position).magnitude if distance < 25 then count = count + 1 if count/2 > 1 then numBats = numBats + math.ceil(count/2) end end end end end if numBats > 6 then numBats = 6 end spawnBats() end
function onEquipped() end
function onUnequipped() numBats = 3 for i = 1, #bats do if bats[i] and bats[i][1] then bats[i][1]:Destroy() bats[i][1] = nil end end bats = {} Hand.Transparency = 0.0 end
Tool.Activated:connect(onActivated) Tool.Equipped:connect(onEquipped) Tool.Unequipped:connect(onUnequipped)
